definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: The incident says so much about the current state of the Iraqi security forces.
sentences.chinese: 這起事件很能說明當時伊拉克安全武裝力量的狀態。

sentences.english: Around 300 troops will remain to help with the training of Iraqi forces.
sentences.chinese: 大約300名士兵將留下幫助訓練伊拉克武裝力量。

sentences.english: "The armed forces do not know what to do, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說，“軍事武裝力量不知道該做什麼”。

sentences.english: The aggressors' armed forces will be wiped out in the end.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者的武裝力量終將被消滅。

sentences.english: The wartime cabinet first recruited men into the forces from non-essential industries.
sentences.chinese: 戰時內閣首先從非重點工業中招募人員補充武裝力量。

sentences.english: The President said he will use the full force of the country against foreign invaders.
sentences.chinese: 總統說他將全國的武裝力量來對付外國入侵者。

sentences.english: The claim comes at a sensitive time for Britain's Armed Forces.
sentences.chinese: 這一建議提出的時間正值英國武裝力量的敏感期。

sentences.english: In 1966 the British announced that all its forces would be withdrawn at independence.
sentences.chinese: 1966年英國宣佈其獨立並撤走所有武裝力量。

definition: United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
